primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Cedar Blitz land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Cedar Blitz? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Cedar Blitz scored 44 out of 100. Grassroots tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Cedar Blitz. Cedar Springs, Michigan. 62 mi. Rolling west Michigan gravel through rural areas.
beats.text_on_screen: Cedar Blitz | Cedar Springs, Michigan | 62 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Value. 4 out of 5. Good value. More bang for your buck than most. Four distance options with full support, timing, medical coverage, and downtown festival atmosphere deliver strong value. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. Downtown Cedar Springs start/finish at the brewery creates centralized logistics with post-race festival atmosphere. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. Four distance options from 18-mile beginner to 130-mile ultra hit the right spread. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Strong community building draws riders nationally — "The BaseCamp community has given me so many cycling friends from across the country. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Mid-range expenses. Budget a proper race weekend. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Beth Huffaker describes the course as "fast, no chunky gravel and no giant hills" - flowing rather than punishing through Michigan farmland. Elevation. 2 out of 5. A few hills. Nothing to lose sleep over. Rider reports confirm "no giant hills" through the 3000 feet of elevation over 62 miles. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Historical weather data shows average highs of 82°F and lows of 63°F, with a 49% chance of rain on any given day.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Light adventure. Nothing wild. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Experience. 2 out of 5. Fine. Just fine. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Zero name recognition. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Sparse start line. Plenty of elbow room.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

weaknesses: Small field with no competitive depth

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Cedar Springs has basic lodging. Grand Rapids has more options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: West Michigan Grassroots Ride. Only if you're in west Michigan or the Grand Rapids area and want an affordable gravel ride. Not worth traveling for.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Cedar Blitz isn't quite right for you. For better Michigan events: Barry-Roubaix, Lumberjack 100. For similar grassroots vibes: other regional Midwest events.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.
